info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 9:06AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL ALLEGHENY AND NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND COUNTIES THROUGH 930 AM EDT... At 906 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Churchill, or over Penn Hills, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Monroeville, Vandergrift, Apollo, Shaler Township, Plum, West Mifflin, Murrysville, Wilkinsburg, New Kensington, and Lower Burrell. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 46 and 61. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 75 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
